turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm calling about a charge on my latest bill. I was charged $75 but my usual monthly rate is $50. I'm really confused and honestly a bit frustrated.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I understand your frustration. I can certainly look into that for you. Can you please provide me with your account number or the phone number associated with your account?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. One moment while I access your account information... Okay, I see the charge here. It looks like the extra $25 is for exceeding your data limit last month. Does that sound right?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Data limit? I thought my plan included unlimited data. Why am I being charged extra? What's the point of 'unlimited' if it's not really unlimited?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your concern. While our plan is advertised as unlimited, it is subject to our fair use policy. After exceeding a certain data threshold, speeds may be reduced. In your case, exceeding the threshold triggered an overage charge. To avoid this in the future, I would recommend upgrading to our premium unlimited plan, or monitoring your data usage in the app. Would you like me to provide you with any further information about plan options or data monitoring?
